'''Rachelle Rhea "Chelle" Rose'''<ref name=CR-newsherald-2016>{{cite news|last1=Lara|first1=Heidi
|title=Lenoir City's Chelle Rose reflects on music career|url=http://www.news-herald.net/news/lenoir-city-s-chelle-rose-reflects-on-music-career/article_e8d533a9-c56b-573c-8523-b7f944388139.html|access-date=June 19, 2017|work=News-Herald|date=September 2, 2016}}</ref> is an American rock, blues, roots singer, songwriter and musician. She released her debut album, “Nanahally River” in 2000.

==Biography==
===Early life===
Rose was raised by her maternal grandparents in [[Lenoir City, Tennessee]]. As a child, she sang and secretly played the piano when no one was home. She was working as an accountant when she was unexpectedly gifted a guitar, and she began singing, playing, and writing. She moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]] in 1996, where she married, raised two children, and recorded her first album.<ref name=CR-guardian-2016>{{cite news|last1=Guarino|first1=Mark|title=Chelle Rose: 'There is magic in just being exactly as you are'|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2016/jul/30/chelle-rose-blue-ridge-blood-nashville|access-date=June 19, 2017|work=The Guardian|date=July 30, 2016}}</ref><ref name=CR-elmore-2016>{{cite news|last1=staff writer|title= the Video for her Sinister Ballad: Reckon with the Devil|url=http://www.elmoremagazine.com/2016/08/music-news/chelle-rose-shares-the-video-for-her-sinister-ballad-reckon-with-the-devil|access-date=June 19, 2017|work=Elmore Magazine|date=August 15, 2016}}</ref><ref name=CR-itmatters-2016>{{cite web|url=http://itmatters.amplifi.fm/artist-q-and-a/chelle-rose-talks-about-tossing-todd-snider-out-of-her-rehearsal-space-and-the-benefit-of-just-enough/|title=Chelle Rose Talks About Tossing Todd Snider Out of her Rehearsal Space and the Benefit of "Just Enough"|work=Why It Matters|access-date=June 18, 2017|archive-date=October 25, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161025221936/http://itmatters.amplifi.fm/artist-q-and-a/chelle-rose-talks-about-tossing-todd-snider-out-of-her-rehearsal-space-and-the-benefit-of-just-enough|url-status=dead}}</ref>

A diagnosis of hypothyroidism in 2014 derailed Rose's music career for more than a year, limiting her exposure. But she has since recovered, and in 2016 she bought her family's homestead and returned to Lenoir City.<ref name=CR-guardian-2016 /><ref>{{cite news|last1=Stallard
|first1=Dave
|title=Trail Mix: Chelle Rose Song Premiere
|url=http://www.blueridgeoutdoors.com/trail-mix/trail-mix-chelle-rose-song-premiere/
|access-date=June 18, 2017
|work=Blue Ridge Outdoors
|date=August 3, 2016}}</ref>

===Style===
Rose writes autobiographical, sometimes dark songs about her childhood and the people who populated her environment in East Tennessee and western North Carolina. She was compared favorably to [[Lucinda Williams]], [[Townes Van Zandt]], [[Steve Earle]], [[Alejandro Escovedo]] "and other terse, unflinching songwriters on the rock fringe of country" by Jon Pareles in the New York Times.<ref name=CR-conqueroo-2016>{{cite web
|url=http://www.conqueroo.com/chellerose.html
|title=Dark Chapters, Sweet Memories Course Through Chelle Ross's Blue Ridge Blood
|work=Conqueroo
|access-date=June 19, 2017
|archive-date=August 4, 2017
|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170804035221/http://www.conqueroo.com/chellerose.html
|url-status=dead
}}</ref>

===Recordings===
Rose's 2000 debut ''Nanahally River'' was produced by David Hardman. [[J. D. Wilkes]] from the [[Legendary Shack Shakers]] played harmonica.

2012's ''Ghost of Browder Holler'' was produced by [[Ray Wylie Hubbard]].<ref name=CR-guardian-2016 /> Performers included Billy Cassis (guitar), Brad Rice (guitar, mandolin), George Reiff (bass), [[The Georgia Satellites|Rick Richards]] (drums), and Hubbard (guitar, harmonica). Additional guests included [[Ian McLagan]] on organ and [[the McCrary Sisters]] and [[Elizabeth Cook]] on harmonies.<ref name=CR-nodep-2016>{{cite news|last1=Minkin|first1=Jay|title=Chelle Rose unveils The Ghost of Browder Holler|url=http://nodepression.com/article/chelle-rose-unveils-ghost-browder-holler|access-date=June 19, 2017|work=No Depression|date=April 17, 2012}}</ref>

Rose's third album ''Blue Ridge Blood'' was released in 2016 and produced by George Reiff ([[Court Yard Hounds]], [[Chris Robinson (singer)|Chris Robinson]]). [[Buddy Miller]] provided harmony vocals on the title track.<ref name=CR-rstone-2016>{{cite magazine|last1=Freeman|first1=Jon|title=Hear Chelle Rose's Defiant 'Blue Ridge Blood'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/hear-chelle-roses-defiant-blue-ridge-blood-20160706|access-date=June 19, 2017|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=July 6, 2016}}</ref> Once again, she was joined by Cassis, Richards, and Reiff, and she was also joined by Johnathon Hamilton (her fiancée) on mandolin, Sergio Webb on guitar and resonator guitar, Johnathan Letner on mandolin, and Bukka Allen on keyboards.<ref name=CR-elmore2-2016>{{cite news|last1=Hynes|first1=Jim|title=Chelle Rose: Blue Ridge Blood|url=http://www.elmoremagazine.com/2016/08/reviews/albums/chelle-rose|access-date=June 19, 2017|work=Elmore Magazine|date=August 5, 2016}}</ref>

==Discography==
* 2000: ''Nanahally River'' (Bloodred Records)
* 2012: ''Ghost of Browder Holler'' (Lil' Damsel Records)
* 2016: ''Blue Ridge Blood'' (Lil' Damsel Records)
